headline: Be Careful with Suspicious Links!
warningMessage: Hey, hold up! You just clicked on a link that could be risky. This time, you're safe — but next time, you might not be so lucky. Scammers are out there trying to trick you, and one wrong click could cost you access to your account.
spotSuspicious: Here’s How to Spot a Suspicious Link:

suspiciousList.title: Too Good to Be True
suspiciousList.description: Offers that sound too perfect — like free stuff — might not be real.

suspiciousList.title: Rushing You
suspiciousList.description: If someone says you need to act fast, take a moment to think.

suspiciousList.title: Strange URLs
suspiciousList.description: Double-check the link — does it look off or have weird characters?

suspiciousList.title: New Accounts
suspiciousList.description: Be cautious with messages from brand-new or unverified accounts.

suspiciousList.title: Hover Over Links
suspiciousList.description: Before clicking, hover over embedded links in Discord to see where they lead. If you see a link shortener (like bit.ly or tinyurl.com), be super cautious — there’s a good chance it could be malicious.

afterClick: What to Do If You Clicked the Link:

afterClickList.title: Update Your Password
afterClickList.description: Change your Discord password and any others you used recently.

afterClickList.title: Turn on 2FA
afterClickList.description: Add extra protection to your accounts with two-factor authentication.

afterClickList.title: Check Your Device
afterClickList.description: Run a quick scan with your antivirus software.

afterClickList.title: Tell a Mod
afterClickList.description: Let a community moderator know, and they can help report it to Discord.

closingMessage: Stay Safe and Think Before You Click!
